original_title: Comparing a Clone Raspberry Pi Pico 2 With an Original One
original_content:
Although [Thomas] really likes the Raspberry Pi Pico 2 and the RP2350 MCU, he absolutely, totally, really doesnt like the micro-USB connector on it. Hence he jumped on the opportunity to source a Pico 2 clone board with the same MCU but with a USB-C connector from AliExpress. After receiving the new board, he set about comparing the two to see whether the clone board was worth it after all. In the accompanying video you can get even more details on why you should avoid this particular clone board.
In the video the respective components of both boards are analyzed and compared to see how they stack up. The worst issues with the clone Pico 2 board are an improper USB trace impedance at 130 Ω with also a cut ground plane below it that wont do signal integrity any favors.
There is also an issue with the buck converter routing for the RP2350 with an unconnected pin (VREG_FB) despite the recommended layout in the RP2350 datasheet. Power supply issues continue with the used LN3440 DC-DC converter which can source 800 mA instead of the 1A of the Pico 2 version and performed rather poorly during load tests, with one board dying at 800 mA load.
title: - USB-C接続のRaspberry Pi Pico 2クローンボードの比較
body: トーマスはRaspberry Pi Pico 2のUSB-Cクローン基板を比較し、問題点を指摘。信号の不具合や電源性能が悪い。
titles: - USB-C接続のRaspberry Pi Pico 2クローンボードの比較
- クローンボードの性能：Raspberry Pi Pico 2との違い
- Pico 2クローンボードの問題点：信号の整合性とパワー供給
- USBトレースインピーダンスとグランドプレーンの重要性
- LN3440 DC-DCコンバータの性能とボード故障の原因分析
